actions.actionTitle: Provide privacy information for organizations
actions.actionDescription: Configure and display privacy notices, consent forms, and data handling policies to comply with privacy regulations. This includes setting up privacy statements in Azure AD, Microsoft 365, and other services to inform users about data collection and processing practices.

actions.actionTitle: Manage Mobile Device Management (MDM) Devices remotely
actions.actionDescription: Implement remote management capabilities for mobile devices through Microsoft Intune, including remote wipe, lock, and password reset. This ensures administrators can protect corporate data on lost or stolen devices and maintain security compliance.

actions.actionTitle: Create a compliance policy
actions.actionDescription: Develop and deploy device compliance policies in Microsoft Intune that define minimum security requirements for devices accessing corporate resources. These policies enforce settings like encryption, OS versions, and threat protection to maintain organizational security standards.

actions.actionTitle: Limit the use of administrative role access
actions.actionDescription: Implement just-in-time (JIT) administrative access through Azure AD Privileged Identity Management to minimize standing administrative privileges. This includes requiring approval and justification for privilege elevation and automatically removing access after a specified time period.

actions.actionTitle: Block legacy authentication
actions.actionDescription: Configure Conditional Access policies in Azure AD to block authentication protocols that don't support modern authentication methods like multi-factor authentication. This prevents attacks that exploit legacy protocols such as POP, SMTP, IMAP, and MAPI.

actions.actionTitle: Configure endpoint security solution integration
actions.actionDescription: Integrate Microsoft Defender for Endpoint with third-party security solutions through APIs and connectors. This enables centralized security management and correlation of threat intelligence across multiple security platforms.

actions.actionTitle: Integrate form-based authentication applications into a central identity and access management engine
actions.actionDescription: Configure Azure AD Application Proxy to provide single sign-on (SSO) for legacy applications using form-based authentication. This centralizes authentication management and enables modern security controls for applications that don't natively support SAML or OAuth.

actions.actionTitle: Disable autoplay for all drives
actions.actionDescription: Configure Group Policy or Intune policies to disable AutoPlay and AutoRun features for all drive types including USB, CD/DVD, and network drives. This prevents malware from automatically executing when removable media is connected to managed devices.

actions.actionTitle: Govern calendar sharing
actions.actionDescription: Establish policies in Exchange Online to control how users can share their calendar information internally and externally. This includes setting default sharing levels, restricting external sharing, and managing calendar publishing to prevent information disclosure.

actions.actionTitle: Employ a secure channel between the Domain Controller and member computers
actions.actionDescription: Configure secure channel communications between domain controllers and member computers using Kerberos and LDAP signing. This ensures authentication traffic is encrypted and protected from man-in-the-middle attacks in hybrid Azure AD environments.

actions.actionTitle: Enable multi-factor authentication for admins
actions.actionDescription: Require multi-factor authentication (MFA) for all administrative accounts through Azure AD Conditional Access policies. This provides an additional layer of security for privileged accounts that have access to sensitive resources and configuration settings.

actions.actionTitle: Enable remote help for your tenant
actions.actionDescription: Activate Microsoft Remote Help capabilities at the tenant level to allow secure remote assistance sessions. This feature enables IT support to provide help while maintaining compliance with security policies and audit requirements.

actions.actionTitle: Disable basic authentication for remotely managed clients
actions.actionDescription: Block basic authentication methods for remote management protocols in Exchange Online and other services. This forces the use of modern authentication methods that support MFA and reduces the risk of credential theft through intercepted plain-text passwords.

actions.actionTitle: Enable endpoint detection (EDR) and response in block mode
actions.actionDescription: Configure Microsoft Defender for Endpoint's EDR in block mode to provide protection even when a third-party antivirus is the primary solution. This enables behavioral blocking and containment capabilities that can stop advanced threats missed by traditional antivirus.

actions.actionTitle: Generate remote connection report for cloud desktops
actions.actionDescription: Create reports on remote desktop connections to Azure Virtual Desktop and Windows 365 Cloud PCs. These reports help monitor user access patterns, identify potential security issues, and ensure compliance with remote access policies.

actions.actionTitle: Deploy security baseline policy
actions.actionDescription: Deploy Microsoft security baselines through Intune to apply recommended security configurations to Windows devices. These baselines include pre-configured settings for Windows security features, browser configurations, and Office applications based on Microsoft best practices.

actions.actionTitle: Discover and manage trends in shadow IT application usage
actions.actionDescription: Use Microsoft Defender for Cloud Apps to discover and analyze shadow IT usage patterns across your organization. This includes identifying unsanctioned cloud applications, assessing their risk levels, and tracking adoption trends to make informed decisions about application governance.

actions.actionTitle: Enable deletion of an existing user
actions.actionDescription: Configure proper user deprovisioning workflows in Azure AD to ensure complete removal of user access when employees leave the organization. This includes automating account deletion, license reclamation, and data retention processes to maintain security and compliance.

actions.actionTitle: Log off idle sessions
actions.actionDescription: Implement automatic session termination for idle users in remote desktop services and cloud applications. This security control prevents unauthorized access to unattended sessions and ensures proper session management across virtual desktop infrastructure.

actions.actionTitle: Enable multi-factor authentication for non-administrative users
actions.actionDescription: Extend multi-factor authentication requirements to all user accounts through Azure AD Conditional Access or Security Defaults. This provides comprehensive protection against password-based attacks and ensures all users contribute to organizational security posture.
